definition: variant of 門檻|门槛[men2 kan3]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
pit/threshold/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing water/☵
erhua variant of 門坎|门坎[men2 kan3]

sentences.english: One of our themes is to lower the barriers to entry.
sentences.chinese: 我們有一個主旨，就是降低入門的門坎。

sentences.english: In 1906, missionary Pev and Mrs Harry Parsons brought potato into this area.
sentences.chinese: 1906年，傳教士張道惠夫人將洋芋引入石門坎。

sentences.english: At the threshold of the 21th century, the age of knowledge-economy is making for us.
sentences.chinese: 站在21世紀的門坎，知識經濟時代正向我們走來。

sentences.english: The corn of God's floor must expect to be threshed by afflictions and persecutions.
sentences.chinese: 上帝屋內地板的一角必是苦難與逼迫的門坎。

sentences.english: This night, is the first walked into a los harp sea of book or reduced.
sentences.chinese: 這一晚，是京洛最初一次走進琴海書寓的門坎。

sentences.english: Whosoever enters through the portals of this home must go out with gladsome heart.
sentences.chinese: 不管誰步入這家的門坎，他將帶着一顆開心的心歸去。
